---
title: "Elgaria multicarinata"
output: html_document
---

Elgaria multicarinata are found in western United States and prefer grassland, open forest and chaparral habitat.
They have a large head and a strong jaw, which enable them to bite with a lot of power.
They hibernate during colder months and mating occurs around April and May.
Long-living and live up to 15 years.
